p:
The genus Phlebovirus, within the family Phenuiviridae (formerly Bunyaviridae) of the order Bunyavirales, contains viruses that cause human diseases, including Rift Valley fever, sandfly fever, and the more recently emerged severe fever with thrombocytopenia syndrome (SFTS) and Heartland virus (HRTV) disease.
1 Phleboviruses are enveloped, negative-sense, single-stranded RNA viruses with a tri-segment genome (large [L], medium [M], and small [S]), containing over 70 viruses grouped into 10 species.
2 This chapter will briefly summarize SFTS virus (SFTSV), HRTV, and the sandfly fever viruses.
